Description:
A graphical interface for using git. Cross-platform, works with GitHub, and free to use for educational purposes. Cheatsheets available:
  • GitKraken cheat sheet
  • GitKraken for GitHub users cheat sheet

A graphical interface for interacting with GitHub, built by GitHub. User documentation from GitHub is available:
  • Getting Starting with GitHub Desktop
  • Contributing to projects with GitHub Desktop

A cross-platform and open-source integrated development environment (IDE) for programming. Uses a plugin system called Extensions to add support for different languages and for interfacing with git and GitHub. At a minimum, you should install the [official extension for Python](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=ms-python.python). There are also [introductory tutorial videos available](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/getstarted/introvideos).

A cross-platform integrated development environment (IDE) designed specifically for programming in Python. Comes with many useful features enabled. Has a plugin ecosystem, but unlike Visual Studio Code they can be treated as optional. There are [introductory tutorial videos available](https://www.jetbrains.com/pycharm/documentation/pycharm-videos.html). As a current student, you get a free professional license for the editor if you [fill out and submit this form](https://www.jetbrains.com/shop/eform/students).
